body_html: I imagine a CPU kernel won't be too hard, but I have almost no knowledge in the eigen library, so it would take a lot of time for me to write a native CPU layer norm kernel in C++. Is it okay to direct the CPU cases to the current layer_norm implementation in tf.contrib.layers library in python?
body_text: I imagine a CPU kernel won't be too hard, but I have almost no knowledge in the eigen library, so it would take a lot of time for me to write a native CPU layer norm kernel in C++. Is it okay to direct the CPU cases to the current layer_norm implementation in tf.contrib.layers library in python?
body: I imagine a CPU kernel won't be too hard, but I have almost no knowledge in the eigen library, so it would take a lot of time for me to write a native CPU layer norm kernel in C++. Is it okay to direct the CPU cases to the current layer_norm implementation in `tf.contrib.layers` library in python?
